data.message: Under what variables did the aircraft takeoff in...well, it sure is Sunny, weather looks clear...my concern is with the many variables aircraft actually TO in...or could not perform in. Before anyone else starts crying, you'd probably want to expose the platform to 'worse case' scenarios...just saying. Things like, 'We need more thrust', 'The solar panels have some iceing problems, Sir', and we '...are out of back-up battery power'. Sweet kite though...

replies.message: Hi John. Over the coming months, we're going to continue test flights. During these flights, we'll be gathering data to test and verify our models for improvement. -Colleen
None of us will ever live to see this. To quote, "You do not have to be a shoemaker to understand the idea that the shoe doesn't fit..."
I really don't expect a response because you have no knowledge of the principles of flight or the conditions necessary to accomplish it.
Put one above or below either artic circle...in NOV, DEC, JAN, FEB, MAR, APR or most of MAY. Will those villagers have access?

Dude jeez what a downer. So only because you are not going to see it in your lifetime, should they stop trying? Selfish and anti-progress. Wonder what Elon Musk would think...

Btw I am sure you know more than everyone about aerodynamics but that doesn't entitle you to be such a jerk about it...
John, those comments could have been made at Kitty Hawk with the Wright brothers invention. We'll all wait to see how this improves, as surely it will.

I don't really care what Mr. Musk thinks...SolarCity is now the second largest provider of solar power systems in the United States...and one of Washington D.C.'s biggest lobbyists'...hmmm, how does that happen? Tax payer $'s, that's how. I have spent a lifetime in the aviation profession. Again, unless he has the ability to change 'planetary weather' patterns, the internet thing is a pipe dream. I'll try not to be a 'jerk', if you'll agree to stop being a moron. Space x is admirable though...

Bill Pfadt...lived just north of Kitty Hawk (actually called Kill Devil Hills) and went to the very place where the Brothers made "...the First Flight", nice museum...so, yeah, I've been there. Again, not trying to put "a downer" on the accomplishment, but Solar will NEVER power flight in certain areas...unless someone discovers how to control climate and weather.
Certainly, in 'the Spirit of the Wright Brothers" that could be realized...someday
